1. Environment.definition: Terrain, climate, weather systems, flora/fauna, and ecological anomalies.

2. Geography & Boundaries.definition: Spatial layout, zones, travel limitations, and structural logic of the world.

3. Power Structures.definition: Systems of governance, control, and authority — political, corporate, spiritual, algorithmic.

4. Social Order.definition: Class, caste, kinship, community, faction dynamics, and societal organization.

5. History & Myth.definition: Origins, wars, lost civilizations, timeline logic, and collective memory or belief.

6. Technology & Tools.definition: Level and type of technology: analog, futuristic, arcane, biotech, etc.

7. Belief & Knowledge Systems.definition: Religion, science, education, ideology, and pathways to truth.

8. Language & Symbol.definition: Forms of communication, sacred symbols, alphabets, or coded systems of meaning.

9. Physics & Laws of Reality.definition: Fundamental rules of matter, time, energy, and metaphysics — or their manipulation.
